early.description: Born on a remote colony, your early years were filled with normalcy until whispers of a mysterious illness began.
At age six, you noticed changes in the adults around you, prompting you to become more observant.
You learned basic survival skills as resources became scarce, showcasing your adaptability.
An encounter with quarantine enforcers taught you the importance of stealth and caution.
You developed a network of hidden pathways to move around undetected.
Witnessing the collapse of colony infrastructure instilled in you a sense of self-reliance.
You customized makeshift tools from scavenged materials, demonstrating ingenuity.
An older survivor taught you about identifying safe zones and contaminated areas.
You formed a bond with another child survivor, sharing knowledge and resources.
A close call with biohazard exposure sharpened your reflexes and instincts.
You began studying medical texts left behind, enhancing your understanding of the outbreak.
An illness in your family tested your resolve and ingenuity in finding a cure.
You discovered a hidden cache of supplies, improving your situation temporarily.
A family member disappeared during chaos, prompting you to become more self-reliant.
You started experimenting with herbal remedies and makeshift treatments.
An encounter with corporate agents hoarding resources sparked your distrust.
You developed a skill for moving unnoticed through restricted areas.

mid.description: You joined a group of survivors, pooling resources and knowledge to stay healthy.
A conflict with another survivor over scarce supplies tested your wits and resolve.
You infiltrated a secured facility to obtain vital medicine, showcasing stealth and courage.
An opportunity to communicate with the outside world arose, challenging your trust.
You began mentoring younger survivors, teaching them how to avoid contamination.
A personal loss due to the outbreak made you question your path.
You discovered evidence of corporate negligence causing the biohazard.
A romantic relationship complicated your survival priorities.
You faced ethical choices when deciding who to help with limited resources.
An injury forced you to adapt your methods, relying more on intelligence than physical ability.

late.description: Elevated to a leadership role among survivors, you coordinated efforts to stay healthy.
A major outbreak threatened your group's existence, requiring decisive action.
You uncovered a plan that could lead to a cure, prompting difficult choices.
Faced with a moral dilemma, you had to choose between personal safety and the greater good.
An opportunity to expose corporate malfeasance challenged your priorities.
You exposed a traitor within your group, preventing further harm.
A personal tragedy prompted deep reflection on your life's direction.
You began to suffer from the psychological effects of prolonged isolation.
A movement to find a permanent safe haven gained momentum, and you had to decide your role.
You mentored a young survivor, hoping to pass on your knowledge.
Conditions worsened, making survival increasingly difficult.
You authored a journal documenting survival techniques and experiences during the quarantine.
An external threat, such as hostile groups or environmental hazards, endangered your group.
You faced a critical decision when offered a chance to escape at the expense of others.
An unexpected alliance offered new possibilities but also new risks.
You considered the legacy you would leave and how to effect lasting change.
A technological advancement changed the dynamics of the quarantine, forcing you to adapt.
